messages.title: TAKE A LONG HARD LOOK AT THE CONSERVATIVES
messages.content: South Derbyshire Conservative leaflets carry no sense of pride in South Derbyshire. No local faces, no local stories and no local people.

messages.title: Labour is ambitious for South Derbyshire.
messages.content: The Conservatives would take us back 20 years.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: To tackle crime, we must understand its true picture. Be firm in using DNA to minimise the chances of serious crime.
Labour is equipping young people for jobs in a globalised economy; greener energy, products and homes; people living longer.

Labour wants to apply the principles of the NHS to long-term care. A mutli cross-party debate was developing the case for change until the Conservatives broke off talks for the sake of a cheap election poster campaign. Labour remains determined to start a National Care Service and to find a solution to pay for a service that will take the fear out of old age.

issues.health: Dementia is more common. The costs of long-term care are high.

images.caption: Photos of various individuals with Michael Edwards.

leaflet.additionalNotes: The leaflet critiques the South Derbyshire Conservatives for voting against new classrooms for William Allitt school in their first budget at the County Council, preferring instead to spend Â£6.4m on new facilities in Ashbourne. It also mentions that they voted down Labour's proposal to repair potholes after a harsh winter.
